wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant General Sir Denis John Charles Kirwan Bernard,  (22 October 1882 – 25 August 1956) was a British Army officer who commanded 3rd Infantry Division. He was also Governor of Bermuda and General Officer Commanding the Bermuda Garrison.

response: Gerald Lathbury was born in Murree, British India on 14 July 1906 into a military family, his father being Colonel (Henry) Oscar Lathbury. Returning to England, he was educated at Wellington College, Berkshire and the Royal Military College, Sandhurst. Passing out from Sandhurst, Lathbury was commissioned as a second lieutenant into the Oxfordshire and Buckinghamshire Light Infantry on 4 February 1926.Liddell Hart Centre for Military Archives He was seconded to the Royal West African Frontier Force and Gold Coast Regiment between 1928 and 1932 and, returning to England, attended the Staff College, Camberley between 1937 and 1938. Promoted to lieutenant on 4 February 1929, he was a captain on 21 March 1938. In January 1939 he became brigade major with the 8th Infantry Brigade, which formed part of the 3rd Infantry Division, whose General Officer Commanding (GOC) was Major General Denis Bernard until he was succeeded in August by Major General Bernard Montgomery, shortly before the Second World War began the following month.

Bernard married firstly Isabel Emma Beatrice Lane in April 1872. His second wife whom he married in February 1880 was Mary Lissey Kirwan who inherited the  estate of Castlehacket.Estate:Kirwan (Castlehacket) He married a third time in June 1900 to Evangeline Hoare, daughter of Henry Hoare (1838–1898) of Staplehurst. After his death she married Charles Hedley Strutt (MP). His son General Sir Denis Bernard was Governor of Bermuda.
